title: Serial numbers on auto assembly documents (late 1960s--1970s)
content:
I see someone changed the subject line on my previous post...real class!

For everyone’s information, the samples I posted were not from US currency...attached is a section of the documents they came from.

Any REAL help would be appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [crop03\_2.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070917/http:/typophile.com/files/crop03_2.JPG) | 264.65 KB |
| [crop22\_2.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070917/http:/typophile.com/files/crop22_2.JPG) | 168.31 KB |

 [‹ (x) Digital Graphics geometric sans logo - Kabel {Frank S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070917/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17668 "Go to previous forum topic") ["acdsee" rounded geometric sans logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070917/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17660 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Littletommy

comments.content: Maybe some monospaces machine type like OCR-B would do it?

I see someone changed the subject line on my previous post…real class!

Sorry ’bout the misunderstanding, Bob, as I moderate this part of Typophile that would’ve been me. You pointing to H&FJ Greenback made me jump to conclusions a bit too fast. You see, we have received quite a few dubious requests in the past , like type on passports, credit cards, currency et al, so we’d rather be safe than sorry.

It would help if you were a bit more specific and used a more descriptive thread title. “Help ID Font...” is pretty redundant, as that’s all we do around here. :^)

Oh, and I _will_ change the subject line again, to allow our type IDers to quickly scan the list of threads in search of requests they might have the answer for.
As for the numerals — H&FJ Greenback is the closest match I know of.
